item.description:
Bonjour!
Voici deux autre opportunities 7/31 and 8/1 to practice your French! Join us for a pique-nique starting at 6PM avec la conversation française et petit dégustation de vin français on the beautiful campus of Trinity College in Hartford. Following the picnic, we will go indoors to view the Franco-Belgian film "Lady Chatterley". Ce film a gagné cinq prix: Best French Film, Best Actress, Best Literary Adaptation, Best Cinematography, and Best Costume Design. It should be stunning. It is not rated, but most likely would receive an "R". Prière d'apporter quelques chose à manger et un petit bouteille de vin français si vous voulez.
For those qui ne peuvent pas diner avec nous, find us in the Cinestudio lobby between the bright orange lights at 7:25.

The next evening, August 1st, features another French film "The Earrings of Madame De...". We will meet outside the theater for a French wine&cheese picnic (and part of the carillon concert) starting at 6PM. (See separate Meetup posting for this)
How to find us in the crowd? Cherchez pour le tour Eiffel avec un drapeau français! We will be on the lawn of the interior "quad" of the campus. Car park on Summit Street or enter from Broad Street and park behind the theater.
Heavy rain would cancel the picnic, but a questionable sky shouldn't stop the merriment! I have a portable canopy that would protect us against all but a monsoon. Film time is 7:30 so meet in the lobby if unable to attend the picnic.

Other French groups in the area are being invited to these events so let's have a grande célébration!
Film admission is $8

group.name: The West Hartford Groupe de French

item.name: French film, wine and picnic
